subject: c++/c
description: This course focuses on pointers and their applications.It leans more towards implementation in C++, rather C. You'll learn the basics of pointers and then move on to understanding and implementing arrays, pointers to arrays & heap based arrays. You'll also learn advanced memory management by creating a custom dynamic array (just like std::vector<T> in standard C++ library). You'll use placement new & delete to directly place objects in a memory pool allocated through operator new function. As you'll see later in the course, this is a powerful mechanism to optimize usage of heap memory with user-defined objects.
